TopicTitle: How do I shut off physics warp?

Articles.Content: The game won't let me shut it off, I keep mashing alt to toggle it off but it won't.

"ALT + <" (decrease warp)

"ALT + >" (increase warp)

You will automatically use physics warp while in the atmosphere.

*Or, I suppose, under cases when the ship is undergoing enough force to prevent timewarp from enabling
Unless your not moving and are on the ground ^
But i'm in space, I mean It won't let me use regular time warp
If you're "rotating" too fast, then you cannot timewarp (Ahem, violate the conservation of momentum).
It just crashed on me do it must have been the game.

Edited May 20, 2013 by WhiteWeasel

Mass / Size of the ship?

The "rotating" is just an example of force, if the ship is undergoing a large amount of internal forces it disables timewarp.

Of course, you could "warp" the ship by switching to a different vessel (i.e. a probe) and warping from there.
If ASAS is on, sometimes the torque from the capsule is enough to prevent timewarp from engaging.
